briefdescription.para: Draw canvas widget for the given invalidated area.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to draw(), but might be invoked several times with increasingly smaller areas to due to memory constraints from the underlying CanvasWidgetRenderer.

parameterdescription.para: The invalidated area.

simplesect.para: true if the widget was drawn properly, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Gets the abstractShape's angle.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter.
The current AbstractShape rotation angle rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current angle of the abstractShape.

simplesect.para: The angle of the AbstractShaperounded down to the precision of int.

briefdescription.para: Gets the x coordinate of a corner (a point) of the shape.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the corner.

simplesect.para: The corner x coordinate in CWRUtil::Q5 format.

briefdescription.para: Gets the y coordinate of a corner (a point) of the shape.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the corner.

simplesect.para: The corner y coordinate in CWRUtil::Q5 format.

briefdescription.para: Gets number of points used to make up the shape.
Gets the position of the shapes (0,0).

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The x coordinate rounded down to the precision of T.
The y coordinate rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets the x scale and y scale of the shape as previously set using setScale.

detaileddescription.para: Default is 1 for both x scale and y scale.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
Scaling of x coordinates rounded down to the precision of T.
Scaling of y coordinates rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Sets the position of the shape's (0,0) in the widget.

detaileddescription.para: This means that all coordinates initially used when created the shape are moved relative to these given offsets. Subsequent calls to moveOrigin() or setOrigin() will replace the old values for origin. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The absolute x coordinate of the shapes position (0,0).
The absolute y coordinate of the shapes position (0,0).

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is invalidated before and after the change.

briefdescription.para: Sets the absolute angle to turn the AbstractShape.

detaileddescription.para: 0 degrees means no rotation and 90 degrees is rotate the shape clockwise. Repeated calls to setAngle(10) will therefore not rotate the shape by an additional 10 degrees. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter.
The absolute angle to turn the abstractShape to relative to 0 (straight up).

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets one of the points (a corner) of the shape in CWRUtil::Q5 format.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the corner.
The x coordinate in CWRUtil::Q5 format.
The y coordinate in CWRUtil::Q5 format.

simplesect.para: Remember to call updateAbstractShapeCache() after calling setCorner one or more times, to make sure that the cached outline of the shape is correct.

briefdescription.para: Sets the position of the shape's (0,0) in the widget.

detaileddescription.para: This means that all coordinates initially used when created the shape are moved relative to these given offsets. Subsequent calls to setOrigin() or moveOrigin() will replace the old values for origin. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The absolute x coordinate of the shapes position (0,0).
The absolute y coordinate of the shapes position (0,0).

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Scale the AbstractShape the given amounts in the x direction and the y direction.

detaileddescription.para: The new scaling factors do not multiply to previously set scaling factors, so scaling by 2 and later scaling by 2 again will not scale by 4, only by 2. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The new scale in the x direction.
The new scale in the y direction.

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Scale the AbstractShape the given amount in the x direction and the y direction.

detaileddescription.para: The new scaling factors do not multiply to previously set scaling factors, so scaling by 2 and later scaling by 2 again will not scale by 4, only by 2. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The scale in the x direction.

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets a shape the struct Points.

detaileddescription.para: The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The points that make up the shape. The pointer must point to an array of getNumPoints() elements of type ShapePoint.

simplesect.para: The area containing the shape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets a shape the struct Points.

detaileddescription.para: The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The points that make up the shape. The pointer must point to an array of getNumPoints() elements of type ShapePoint.

simplesect.para: The area containing the shape is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Updates the AbstractShape cache.

detaileddescription.para: The cache is used to be able to quickly redraw the AbstractShape without calculating the points that make up the abstractShape (with regards to scaling and rotation).

briefdescription.para: Sets the absolute angle to turn the AbstractShape.

detaileddescription.para: 0 degrees means no rotation and 90 degrees is rotate the shape clockwise. Repeated calls to setAngle(10) will therefore not rotate the shape by an additional 10 degrees. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter.
The angle to turn the abstractShape.

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is invalidated before and after the change.

briefdescription.para: Scale the AbstractShape the given amount in the x direction and the y direction.

detaileddescription.para: The new scaling factors do not multiply to previously set scaling factors, so scaling by 2 and later scaling by 2 again will not scale by 4, only by 2. The cached outline of the shape is automatically updated.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The new scale in the x direction.
The new scale in the y direction.

simplesect.para: The area containing the AbstractShape is invalidated before and after the change.

briefdescription.para: Gets cached x coordinate of a point/corner.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the point/corner.

simplesect.para: The cached x coordinate, or zero if nothing is cached for the given i.

briefdescription.para: Gets cached y coordinate of a point/corner.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the point/corner.

simplesect.para: The cached y coordinate, or zero if nothing is cached for the given i.

briefdescription.para: Gets minimal rectangle containing the shape drawn by this widget.

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation returns the size of the entire widget, but this function should be overwritten in subclasses and return the minimal rectangle containing the shape. See classes such as Circle for example implementations.

simplesect.para: The minimal rectangle containing the shape drawn.

briefdescription.para: Sets the cached coordinates of a given point/corner.

detaileddescription.para: The coordinates in the cache are the coordinates from the corners after rotation and scaling has been applied to the coordinate.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the corner.
The x coordinate.
The y coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Simple widget capable of drawing a abstractShape.

detaileddescription.para: The abstractShape can be scaled and rotated around 0,0. The shapes points (corners) are calculated with regards to scaling and rotation to allow for faster redrawing. Care must be taken to call updateAbstractShapeCache() after updating the shape, the scale of the shape or the rotation of the shape.
